definition: to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from

sentences.english: Can Albertsons Trounce Wal-Mart with Advanced Information Technology?
sentences.chinese: 可以艾伯森痛打沃爾瑪先進的信息技術沃爾瑪？

sentences.english: You will be beaten up by him if you fight him.
sentences.chinese: 如果你和他打起來，你將會被痛打一頓。

sentences.english: That dog would have been be. aten to act like that over a number of years.
sentences.chinese: 這隻狗可能是被痛打多年才練成這樣。

sentences.english: He's frightened to stay out late in case his mother lays into him again.
sentences.chinese: 他很怕在外邊呆得太晚，唯恐母親又要把他痛打一頓。

sentences.english: 'Is it right she belted old George in the gut?' she asked.
sentences.chinese: “她真的把老喬治痛打了一頓？”她問。

sentences.english: The theif was severely drubbed for stealing the car.
sentences.chinese: 那賊因偷汽車被痛打了一頓。

sentences.english: He told the police that he had been beaten up by two masked men.
sentences.chinese: 他告訴警察說兩個蒙面人把他痛打了一頓。

sentences.english: Dick settled an old score with Bob by beating him.
sentences.chinese: 迪克痛打鮑勃，以雪舊恨。

sentences.english: A thrashing administered especially as punishment.
sentences.chinese: 這個孩子被痛打了一頓。

sentences.english: They blustered about how they would beat us all up.
sentences.chinese: 他們威脅說他們要如何痛打我們大家。

sentences.english: The bully said he was going to duke out anyone who disagreed.
sentences.chinese: 那惡霸說他要痛打任何不同意的人。

sentences.english: Fearlessly, Tom lashed into the robbers, who soon ran away.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆勇猛無畏地痛打搶劫犯，很快就把他們打跑了。

sentences.english: Id reisly like to see more nations bitchslap Monsanto.
sentences.chinese: 我真希望看到更多的國家痛打孟山都這條惡狗。

sentences.english: Alex hits him and then arrests him.
sentences.chinese: 阿萊斯對他一頓痛打，又將他逮捕起來。

sentences.english: Bob dusted off Larry, and threatened to kill him.
sentences.chinese: 鮑勃把拉里痛打一頓後，又威脅說要幹掉他。

definition: to beat up/to break to pieces
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
to thump repeatedly with one's fist
to be looking for one's teeth all over the floor/(fig.) to get beaten up badly/to beat the crap out of (sb)
